snippet: On Monday, Wizards of the Coast, the Hasbro subsidiary that owns Dungeons & Dragons, announced that a new edition is under development: and players will weigh in on how to reboot the franchise.
abstract: Wizards of the Coast is developing a new edition of the classic role-playing game Dungeons & Dragons; plans to ask for input from the game's large fan base, which has become fractured over rule revisions in the past.
lead_paragraph: On Monday, Wizards of the Coast, the Hasbro subsidiary that owns Dungeons & Dragons, announced that a new edition is under development: and players will weigh in on how to reboot the franchise.

headline.seo: Dungeons & Dragons Remake Uses Players’ Input
headline.main: Players Roll the Dice for Dungeons & Dragons Remake
headline.print_headline: Dungeons & Dragons Give Players a Role In Game's Overhaul
